title: Suppose the Tsar Bomba was launched 100 miles above Earth and was detonated. What would happen? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tell me. When it was first tried out above Novaya Zemlya, how many people did it kill? How much impact did it have on you in 1962? I must admit that my Halloween bag wasn’t any larger thanks to it. Yeah, it would probably cause some problems electrically, below whatever patch of the planet you decide you want moved back to the age of steam. In 1962 an “edge of space” test by the Soviet Union caused a current that started a fire and burned down a power plant in Khazakhstan at 300 km.

At full yield (100 Mt VS the test yield of 50 Mt), the EMP would probably wipe out most electronic devices in the hemisphere it was detonated over. The problem would be getting this bad boy into orbit to begin with:  It weighs as much as the the Apollo capsule and service modules that went to the moon, so you’d have to be able to hide something the size of a Saturn V rocket from your opponent.
